results.title: Slippery slide
results.creator_credit: Donald Crombie, Damien Parer and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A dramatised film examining the relevant life experiences of a boy and his sister who have gone through the “Welfare” system as neglected children, been given to foster parents, and eventually, through a series of incidents, end up in jail. Intended to help change attitudes towards welfare children and raise the consciousness of the community towards betterment of the child welfare system Cast includes Simon Burke; John Waters; Arkie Whitely.

results.title: Slip of the tongue
results.creator_credit: Bob Scarfe and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Considers the issue of speech problems in the classroom in terms of what type of problems are referrable to a speech pathologist. Presents teachers with a guide to what speech problems to look out for in the classroom. Describes language, articulation, voice and fluency.

results.title: Sling blade
results.creator_credit: Billy Bob Thornton, David L. Bushell, Brandon Rosser and Shooting Gallery
results.brief_description: Thornton stars as Karl Childers, a simple man who has spent the last 25 years in a mental institution for the murders of his mother and her lover. On the day he is to be released, Karl tells his story to two journalists and we learn the shocking circumstances surrounding the crime. Now out in the world, Karl experiences cruelty from some locals, kindness from others - especially a young boy and his mother, with whom he develops an unlikely friendship. However, when the mother’s abusive boyfriend appears on the scene, Karl is thrust into an explosive predicament that builds to a gripping, unexpected and unforgettable climax. Winner of the 1996 Academy Award for Best Adapted Screenplay.

results.title: Slime molds: plant, animal, or?
results.brief_description: This film illustrates some of the problems of classifying plants and animals by exploring the biological significance of slime molds: a case in point. The slime mold is suggestive at different times of both plants and animals. Docmented here are plasmodial movement and formation of spores.

results.title: Slima the dhowmaker: Tanzania
results.creator_credit: Paul Saltzman, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Sunrise Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”.
A Tanzanian teenager is apprenticed to a dhow-builder and learns skills unchanged for two thousand years. The film shows the building of a boat and the ceremony surrounding its launching.

results.title: Slim pickings
results.brief_description: Using plasticene animation and miniature sets, motion control camera work and in camera effects, “Slim pickings” is a short animation mixing Hitchcock suspense with classic tragedy. On a hungry planet, a close friendship is tested. Cinematography by David Stevens.

results.title: Slightly Scary Stories
results.brief_description: There are three stories on this video: “The Trip” about a lonely boy who constructs a shoebox diorama of the city and flies off to visit old friends. “Georgie” a homeless ghost searching for a new haunt and “A Dark, Dark, Tale” …’Once upon a time there was a dark, dark moor. On the moor there was a dark, dark wood…’

results.title: Sliding into danger
results.creator_credit: John G. Berry and Dormar Productions
results.brief_description: Snow, mud, frost, wet and unstable surfaces present road hazards to the motorist in all types of vehicles. Shows how to handle a car under these conditions.

results.title: Sliding doors
results.creator_credit: Peter Howitt, William Horberg, Philippa Braithwaite, Sydney Pollack, Miramax Films and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Losing her job triggers a strange turn of events for Helen (Gwyneth Paltrow) when she discovers two possibilities for her future. These possibilities are based on the sliding door which signifies whether she catches or misses the train home, and these two scenarios are followed in a parallel sequence. In the world in which she misses her train, Helen works hard at menial jobs to support herself and her unfaithful, writer boyfriend Gerry (John Lynch). In the world in which she catches the train, Helen discovers that getting over discovering Gerry’s infidelity is not as bad as she thought when she begins a relationship with James (John Hannah). Through her happiness however comes unexpected confusion, as nothing is as it seems on the surface. Ultimately the two worlds coalesce, but only one man can accompany her into the future. Cast includes Jean Tripplehorn, Zara Turner and Douglas McFerran.

results.title: Slide rule: percentage, proportion, squares and square roots
results.creator_credit: F.E. Brooker and Loucks and Norling Studios
results.brief_description: Using a rule with only “C” and “D” scales, multiplication and division operations are revised. Problems in proportion are solved, using both left and right index. Problems in percentage solved using the proportion method. Use of the rule with “A”, “B”, “C” and “D” scales. Procedures for determining squares and square roots are demonstrated.
